citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale Hydrographic Geodatabase of the United States

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

descript.abstract: This geodatabase contains streams, waterbodies and wetlands, streamflow gaging stations, and coastlines for the United States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The streams are incorporated into a geometric network. All feature classes are vertically integrated with each other and with 1:1,000,000-scale transportation and boundary data sets.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.

place.placekt: Organization for International Standards, 2008, ISO 3166 Country Codes, https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#search.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of the National Atlas of the United States of America would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Atlas of the United States

cntinfo.cntinst: For questions about this geodatabase or metadata, please contact the National Atlas using the information above, or through the U.S. Geological Survey contact page at http://www.usgs.gov/ask/. For distribution questions, please see the Distribution Information elsewhere in this metadata.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise Version 6.1.7601 (Build 7601); ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy was reported in the metadata for the individual hydrographic map layers.

dataqual.logic: Network connectivity was verified by tracing upstream from all outlets. Topology between streams, waterbodies, coastlines, and gages was checked in the individual hydrographic map layers to ensure features were vertically integrated.
dataqual.complete: This geodatabase contains features in the United States, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal accuracy was reported in the metadata for the individual hydrographic map layers.

vertacc.vertaccr: No checks were made for vertical accuracy.

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

procstep.procdesc:
Selection of Features
All features from National Atlas Streams 1:1M 2014, National Atlas Waterbodies 1:1M 2014, National Atlas Stream Gages 1:1M 2014, and National Atlas Coastline 1:1M 2014 were selected for the U.S. hydrographic geodatabase.

Creation of the Geometric Network
A geometric network was created from the streams. The network uses the Enabled attribute; all streams with an Enabled value of 1 (EnabledDomain value of True) participate in the network. Flow direction was established using the digitized direction of the streams.

overview.eaover: The feature classes and their associated attributes describe hydrographic features in the United States, including streams, waterbodies and wetlands, streamflow gaging stations, coastlines, and the hydrography network. Each feature class is a single entity and has at least one attribute.
overview.eadetcit: Full descriptions of attributes, attribute values, and compilation methods for the streams, waterbodies and wetlands, streamflow gaging stations, and coastlines are available in their respective national metadata records, which are included in the downloadable file with the geodatabase.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.
